description: Indian Liver Patient Dataset for predicting liver disease. Contains biochemical and demographic data collected from patients in North East Andhra Pradesh, India.

original_source.creator: Bendi Venkata Ramana, M. Surendra Prasad Babu, N. B. Venkateswarlu
original_source.publication: Ramana, B.V., Babu, M.S.P., & Venkateswarlu, N.B. (2012). A Critical Comparative Study of Liver Patients from USA and INDIA: An Exploratory Analysis. International Journal of Computer Science Issues, 9(3).

columns.name: age
columns.semantic_description: Age of the patient - any patient whose age exceeded 89 is listed as being of age 90.

columns.name: gender
columns.semantic_description: Gender of the patient - male or female biological sex.

columns.name: total_bilirubin
columns.semantic_description: Total bilirubin (mg/dL) - yellowish pigment in blood, elevated levels indicate liver dysfunction.

columns.name: direct_bilirubin
columns.semantic_description: Direct (conjugated) bilirubin (mg/dL) - water-soluble form processed by liver.

columns.name: alkaline_phosphatase
columns.semantic_description: Alkaline phosphatase (IU/L) - enzyme elevated in liver disease or bile duct obstruction.

columns.name: alanine_transaminase
columns.semantic_description: Alanine aminotransferase/SGPT (IU/L) - liver enzyme, elevated levels indicate liver damage.

columns.name: aspartate_transaminase
columns.semantic_description: Aspartate aminotransferase/SGOT (IU/L) - enzyme released when liver is damaged.

columns.name: total_protein
columns.semantic_description: Total proteins (g/dL) - sum of albumin and globulin, indicates liver synthetic function.

columns.name: albumin
columns.semantic_description: Albumin (g/dL) - protein made by liver, low levels suggest liver disease.

columns.name: albumin_globulin_ratio
columns.semantic_description: A/G ratio - albumin to globulin ratio, altered in liver disease.

target_classes.name: yes
target_classes.meaning: Patient has liver disease - confirmed liver patient

target_classes.name: no
target_classes.meaning: Patient does not have liver disease - non-liver patient

dataset_history: Collected as part of comparative study between USA and Indian liver patients. Original dataset had 583 records with 416 liver patients and 167 non-liver patients. Contains 441 male and 142 female patient records, showing gender imbalance.
inference_notes: Dataset shows significant class imbalance with 71.4% liver patients. Gender imbalance (75.6% male) may reflect disease prevalence or sampling bias. Biochemical markers show effectiveness varies by gender, suggesting need for stratified analysis. The albumin/globulin ratio provides integrated measure of liver function. Missing values exist in some biochemical measurements.
